intro: Mecodium rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed mecodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
